poem:
Anthea's Reflection  

In the blue glow of the screen,  
the child within trembles,  
afraid of the shadow behind –  
a marionette of lights and smiles,  
born of Stoke's dust.  
Yet, in each broadcast,  
a story unfolds,  
woven with invisible threads,  
as the realness flickers like  
a fragile lantern in the wind  
— transparent yet unseen.
